head.title: [Before 27 May 1712]. – Summary of the Proposals given into the Senate of Mosco, by one Garthside, a British factor

note.bibl: NA Kew, Russia, no. SP 91-7, f. 310-311v. English copy

div.p: Summary of the Proposals given into the Senate of Mosco{{o0058}}, by one Garthside{{p2015}}, a British factor

That Garthside & Company{{o0138}} should have free liberty without any restraint, to build ships of what burthen or nature they pleased in any Part of Russia, with all manner of Vessels proper for the Fishery in the White Sea, & to cut all sorts of Fir timber fit for that service, & especially Masts of all Sises ; to erect saw Mills, Iron Forges, & other works relating to ship building, & Masting, to make Docks Wet & Dry, Havens, & Harbours.

That they would undertake to bring from beyond sea, Master builders, Carpenters, Block makers, Mast makers, Rope Masters, Carvers, Joyners, Officers, & Sailors for the said ships, & that they would teach the Czar’s Subjects the method of building & navigating, for which purpose eight hundred young Russes should be furnished them for ten years, the Company{{p0138}} fending their subsistence, & paying 800 Dollars a year into the Treasury during that time : That such as had Capacity should be put to learn the Trades under the Forreign Masters, & the rest bred up officers & sailors ; That after they had serv’d three years in the Vessels to be employ’d on the Fishery a hundred should be sent yearly to the Company{{o0138}} in England, to perfect themselves in other Voyages, & these to be chang’d from time to time.
That they would erect schools for teaching Navigation, Mathematichs, &c & build Hospitals for their sicks.
That they would erect Rope walks, & hd the sole liberty of making & exporting Cordage.

That they would set up a Manufacture of sail Cloath, & Linnen Cloath, on Liberty of buying weedash & Tar from the Peasants any where in the Government of Archangel, for the use of these Manufactures, & exporting these mainly [?] on a moderate Custome.
That they would set up Furnaces, Forges, & all sorts of works, for Achors, Nails, Guns, Powder, and have the exportation Custome free.
That they would erect works for making Soap, & Refining Sugar.
That they would have the sole liberty of brewing Beer in Archangel, & exporting malt from thence.
That free liberty should be given them to purchase & export all sorts of Provisions.
That a thousand Peasants should dbe furnish’d them yearly, for building the said works at two Copeeks (being less then three half pence) a day.

That all their Prentecies, & these Peasants should not be taken for soldiers, or any other service in consideration of which exemption, they should pay the same duty as other Burghers, & the Company{{o0138}} would furnish His Majesty{{p0174}} with fifty Dragons, their Horses and Accountrements.
For better employing the said ships people, the Company{{o0138}} further demands, that 500 pudes of Iszing glap be deliverd them yearly out of the Treasury, at a set Price.
That they have liberty to fish for whales, sea Horse, seals, Cod, Salmon, & all other sort of fish
in the Czars seas, That is from River Pechinkan to the Streights of Weygats, or to purchase all sort of Fish, Oyl, or blubber, in those seas, & to prepare them on the Coasts of Lapland &c.
The sole liberty of seeking for & exporting the Roof Marona, the use whereof has not been known here.
The sole liberty of making & exporting yearly two hundred Fats of the best Cavear, two thousand Fats of Potash, & two thousand fats of Weedach, with the sole exportation of Hempseed & Flaxseed.

The liberty of cutting yearly 180 Masts of the largest Size, & the sole exportation of them, & whatever number they think fit for lesser proportions, with all sorts of Deal bords, Planks, Balks, yards, or Bruses, That these be onely sent on ships built in Russia, & man’d by the Czars Subjects.
The free liberty of purchaseing all other sorts o Comodities, on the same footing, with the Natives.
The liberty to trade throu Moscovy to Persia & China, & to Ship all or any of the Goods above mention’d, from any Port in the East Sea, as well as Archangel.
# That to carry on this Project the Company{{o0138}} would erect a Bank at Archangel.

That they would deliver yearly 400 pude of Dollars & 6/m pude of Copper 200/m Arshines of Cloath 6/m pieces of Pennistones 8/m pude of Tobacco & 2/m Berquets of Lead, all which would amount to 357/m Rubles ; But the Dollars & Copper alone when coyn’d down into the mony of this Country as at present, would produce the said sum of 357/m Rubles ; by which method the other goods would come free into the Treasury. That for this

purpose they demande one third Part, or an hundred and nineteen thousand Rubles, to be immediately advanced them, & the remaining to two thirds or 238/m Rubles in 1713 when the Dollars & Copper should be coin’d.
That the Profit of these Dollars, with others which they propose to pay for their Custome & Exoprtations, would amount to 4 or 500/m Rubles yearly.

That in consideration hereof, they demand a Remission of Custome on their Exportations to the value of 100/m Rubles for the first five years, & the Confirmation of their Privileges for thirty years from the 1st: of Jan[uary] 1713.

That they would erect another Bank at Amsterdamand deliver for His Majestys accounts under Forreign names, 400/m Gilders at six p cent for ten years ; That Dollars should be purchased for this sum sent in specie to Archangel, coin’d down into Russ miny, & remitted back yearly according to the course of the Exchange ; which at end of the said ten years would produce 1,149 300, Rubles, whereof 213026 Rubles being repaid to the Company{{o0138}} for their Principle & Interest, these would remain a fund of 936,274 Rubles clear gains to the Czar{{p01740}}.

That they would erect an office in Archangel for insuring al goods & ships sailing from thence, that the mony for the Insurance should be paid by Bills in England or Holland, & remitted to Mosco in specie for the mint, to clear profit of which, with probable deduction allow’d for loss of ships &c: would amount to 80500 Rubles p annum.
